definition: to deceive/to cheat/to hoodwink/to make a wild guess
Mongol ethnic group/abbr. for Mongolia 蒙古國|蒙古国[Meng3 gu3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Meng2]
to cover/ignorant/to suffer (misfortune)/to receive (a favor)/to cheat

sentences.english: This is an instance of stupidity not dishonesty.
sentences.chinese: 这只是个蒙昧的例子并非不敦朴。
偶尔辰，蒙昧也是一种福泽。

sentences.english: As long as had ignorance and self-confidence, you can succeed by all means.
sentences.chinese: 只要具备了蒙昧和自信，你就一定能乐成。

sentences.english: Her powers had received no aid from education: she was ignorant and illiterate.
sentences.chinese: 她的才能没能得到教育的帮助，她蒙昧无知。

sentences.english: Man has been the dominant sex since, well, the dawn of mankind.
sentences.chinese: 从蒙昧时期开始，男子一直以来都是主导性别。

sentences.english: His work suffers from the obscurantism typical of the Christian era.
sentences.chinese: 他的作品具有基督教时代所特有的蒙昧主义的缺点。

sentences.english: Author also infer that the phenomenon have something to do with influence of uncivilized convention of "Yin Period" persons' religion.
sentences.chinese: 并推测这也许是殷人宗教蒙昧风习影响宋人所致。

definition: devour raw meat and fowl (of savages)
to enlighten/to civilize/to indoctrinate/to train (an animal)
ignorant masses/to keep the people in ignorance
a sage/wise and holy man/virtuous ruler/Buddhist lama/wine
(lit.) gathering place of fish or other creatures/(fig.) haunt/lair/nest/den/hotbed
slave-owning society (precedes feudal society 封建社會|封建社会 in Marxist theory)
